result.execSummary:
The defendant Hector R Acevedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12-31-2016; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
Fine is set at ZERO.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence; straight time. Credit of 99 days  (05-13-2015 to 08-21-2015) time served. 
No drivers license suspension imposed
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
**10/12/2015  credit amended to ZERO days.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hector R Acevedo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Hector R Acevedo not in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received from DOC

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter in response to defendant's request for sentence credit with copy of courts 10/13/15 order enclosed.
Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit.

Order Amending Judgment Of Conviction - the judgment of conviction shall be amended to state zero (0) days of sentence credit - signed by the Court and filed.  Copies mailed to parties.
Clerk:  jms
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. mag
DOC request to review sentence credit order.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 10 MONTHS House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence; straight time; with credit for 99 days (05-13-2015 to 08-21-2015) time served. 

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- No drivers license suspension imposed
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12-31-2016; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;

Defendant Hector R Acevedo in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Defendant Hector R Acevedo in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 
AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to Sentencing hearing.

Defendant Hector R Acevedo in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Defendant Hector R Acevedo in custody. Paul Hauer on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea and sentencing. Case proceed to plea hearing. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Court orders case adjourned for additional time and discussion with attorney. Case adjourned for status conference/projected plea and sentencing hearing on 08-21-2015 at 8:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hector R Acevedo in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Defendant Hector R Acevedo in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea hearing. Defense request an adjournment. Court orders case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing, branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hector R Acevedo in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Paul Hauer on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea hearing, Branch 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Hector R Acevedo in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Defendant Hector R Acevedo in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Martin Keck-Wauwatosa Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Hector R Acevedo in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Hector R Acevedo in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  
Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
